education_text.0: From 1967 to 1968, McIlroy also served as a visiting lecturer at      University of Oxford Oxford UniversityFrom 1967 to 1968, McIlroy also served as a visiting lecturer at      University of Oxford Oxford UniversityIn 1997, McIlroy retired from Bell Labs, and took a position as an Adjunct Professor in the      Dartmouth College Dartmouth College Computer Science DepartmentHe has previously served the      Association for Computing Machinery Association for Computing Machinery as national lecturer,      Turing Award Turing Award chairman, member of the publications planning committee, and associate editor for the      Communications of the ACM Communications of the ACM, the      Journal of the ACM Journal of the ACM, and      ACM Transactions on Programming Languages and Systems ACM Transactions on Programming Languages and SystemsHe also coauthored M6 macro processor in      redirect    FORTRAN IV FORTRAN IV,          which was used in      ALTRAN          and later was ported to and included into      Research Unix early versions of Unix
